chapters.name: Patterns in Mathematics
agenda: Recognize mathematical patterns in numbers and shapes
Develop logical thinking through pattern formation
Apply patterns to predict future values

session_instructions.text: Introduce patterns using numbers, shapes, and real-life examples
Students create and extend number and shape patterns

divisions.name: Number Patterns
conceptual_understanding: Patterns follow a logical rule
Numbers can increase, decrease, or repeat in patterns

divisions.name: Shape Patterns
conceptual_understanding: Shapes can follow repeating or growing patterns

divisions.name: Patterns in Real Life
conceptual_understanding: Patterns exist in daily life such as calendars and designs
student_can_achieve: Relate mathematical patterns to real-world examples

chapters.name: Lines and Angles
agenda: Identify types of lines and angles

session_instructions.text: Explain lines and angles using drawings and real objects
Measure angles using a protractor

divisions.name: Types of Lines
conceptual_understanding: Lines can be parallel, intersecting, or perpendicular

divisions.name: Types of Angles
conceptual_understanding: Angles are classified based on their measures
student_can_achieve: Identify acute, right, obtuse, and straight angles

divisions.name: Measuring Angles
conceptual_understanding: Angles are measured in degrees using a protractor

chapters.name: Number Play
agenda: Develop logical thinking using number games

session_instructions.text: Explain number properties using simple examples
Solve number puzzles and divisibility games

divisions.name: Factors and Multiples
conceptual_understanding: Factors divide a number exactly
Multiples are obtained by repeated addition
student_can_achieve: Find factors and multiples of numbers

divisions.name: Prime and Composite Numbers
conceptual_understanding: Prime numbers have exactly two factors
Composite numbers have more than two factors

divisions.name: Divisibility Rules
conceptual_understanding: Divisibility rules simplify checking factors
student_can_achieve: Apply divisibility tests quickly in exams

chapters.name: Data Handling and Presentation
agenda: Represent data using tables and graphs

session_instructions.text: Introduce data collection through surveys
Create bar graphs from collected data

divisions.name: Collection of Data
conceptual_understanding: Data is information collected for analysis

divisions.name: Tabular Representation
conceptual_understanding: Tables organize data systematically

divisions.name: Graphs
conceptual_understanding: Graphs visually represent data

chapters.name: Prime Time
agenda: Apply LCM and HCF in problems

session_instructions.text: Explain primes using factor trees
Students perform prime factorization using number cards

divisions.name: Prime Numbers
conceptual_understanding: Prime numbers have exactly two factors
1 is neither prime nor composite
student_can_achieve: Identify prime numbers up to a given limit

divisions.name: Prime Factorization
conceptual_understanding: Any composite number can be written as a product of primes

divisions.name: LCM and HCF
conceptual_understanding: LCM is the smallest common multiple
HCF is the greatest common factor
student_can_achieve: Solve LCM and HCF problems in exams

session_instructions.text: Introduce perimeter and area using everyday objects
Measure classroom objects and calculate perimeter/area

divisions.name: Perimeter of Plane Figures
conceptual_understanding: Perimeter is the total length of a boundary
student_can_achieve: Calculate perimeter of rectangles and squares

divisions.name: Area of Rectangles and Squares
conceptual_understanding: Area measures surface covered by a shape

divisions.name: Real-Life Applications
conceptual_understanding: Measurement concepts apply to daily life
student_can_achieve: Solve word problems involving area and perimeter

chapters.name: Fractions
agenda: Understand fractions as parts of a whole

session_instructions.text: Introduce fractions using visual models like pies and strips
Students represent fractions using paper folding

image_assets.name: Fraction Models
image_assets.relevant: Visualizing fractions as parts of a whole

divisions.name: Understanding Fractions
conceptual_understanding: Fractions represent equal parts of a whole

divisions.name: Equivalent Fractions
conceptual_understanding: Equivalent fractions represent the same value

divisions.name: Comparing Fractions
conceptual_understanding: Fractions can be compared using common denominators

divisions.name: Fractions in Daily Life
conceptual_understanding: Fractions appear in measurements and sharing

session_instructions.text: Demonstrate constructions step-by-step on board
Students perform constructions using ruler and compass

divisions.name: Constructing Line Segments
conceptual_understanding: Line segments can be constructed accurately using tools
student_can_achieve: Construct line segments of given lengths

divisions.name: Constructing Angles
conceptual_understanding: Angles have measurable degrees

divisions.name: Logical Reasoning in Constructions
conceptual_understanding: Constructions follow logical steps

chapters.name: Symmetry
agenda: Apply symmetry in patterns and designs

session_instructions.text: Explain symmetry using mirror images and paper folding
Students fold paper shapes to find lines of symmetry

divisions.name: Symmetrical Shapes
conceptual_understanding: A symmetrical shape can be divided into equal halves

divisions.name: Lines of Symmetry
conceptual_understanding: A shape can have one or more lines of symmetry

divisions.name: Symmetry in Everyday Life
conceptual_understanding: Symmetry appears in nature, art, and architecture

chapters.name: The Other Side of Zero
agenda: Represent integers on a number line

session_instructions.text: Introduce negative numbers using temperature and debt examples
Plot integers on a number line

divisions.name: Introduction to Integers
conceptual_understanding: Integers include positive numbers, zero, and negative numbers
student_can_achieve: Identify integers in daily life situations

divisions.name: Integers on a Number Line
conceptual_understanding: Number lines help visualize integers
student_can_achieve: Plot integers correctly on a number line

divisions.name: Real-Life Applications of Integers
conceptual_understanding: Integers represent quantities like temperature and profit/loss

session_instructions.text: Discuss everyday activities and link them to science
Students list daily-life examples where science is used

divisions.name: What Is Science?
conceptual_understanding: Science helps us understand the natural world
Scientific knowledge grows through observation and experiments
student_can_achieve: Give examples of science in daily life

divisions.name: Science Around Us
conceptual_understanding: Science improves human life and technology
student_can_achieve: Identify applications of science at home and school

chapters.name: Diversity in the Living World
agenda: Learn basic classification of plants and animals

session_instructions.text: Introduce living organisms using pictures and videos
Group organisms based on given characteristics

divisions.name: Living and Non-living Things
conceptual_understanding: Living things grow, breathe, and reproduce
Non-living things do not show life processes

divisions.name: Classification of Living Organisms
conceptual_understanding: Organisms are grouped based on similarities
student_can_achieve: Classify plants and animals using basic features

divisions.name: Importance of Biodiversity
conceptual_understanding: Biodiversity maintains ecological balance

chapters.name: Mindful Eating: A Path to a Healthy Body
agenda: Understand the need for food and nutrition
Learn components of a balanced diet
Develop healthy and mindful eating habits

session_instructions.text: Explain nutrients using food examples familiar to students
Students design a one-day balanced diet chart

divisions.name: Why Do We Need Food?
conceptual_understanding: Food provides energy for growth and repair
Different foods serve different body needs

divisions.name: Nutrients and Balanced Diet
conceptual_understanding: Balanced diet contains carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins, and minerals

divisions.name: Healthy Eating Habits
conceptual_understanding: Mindful eating promotes long-term health

session_instructions.text: Demonstrate magnetic attraction using classroom objects
Students test magnetic and non-magnetic materials

divisions.name: Magnetic and Non-magnetic Materials
conceptual_understanding: Magnets attract certain materials like iron

divisions.name: Magnetic Poles and Properties
conceptual_understanding: Like poles repel and unlike poles attract

divisions.name: Uses of Magnets
conceptual_understanding: Magnets are used in daily-life devices

session_instructions.text: Introduce measurement using classroom objects and rulers
Students measure objects and classify types of motion

divisions.name: Measurement of Length
conceptual_understanding: Standard units make measurement uniform
Correct measurement requires proper alignment
student_can_achieve: Measure objects accurately using standard units

divisions.name: Types of Motion
conceptual_understanding: Motion can be linear, circular, or periodic
student_can_achieve: Identify types of motion in daily life

divisions.name: Motion Around Us
conceptual_understanding: Objects show motion when their position changes

session_instructions.text: Introduce materials using everyday objects
Group materials based on hardness, transparency, and conductivity

divisions.name: Types of Materials
conceptual_understanding: Materials differ in appearance and use
student_can_achieve: Identify materials used in daily life

divisions.name: Properties of Materials
conceptual_understanding: Materials have properties like hardness, solubility, and conductivity

divisions.name: Uses of Materials
conceptual_understanding: Material properties determine their uses
student_can_achieve: Justify why certain materials are used for specific purposes

session_instructions.text: Explain temperature using hot and cold object examples
Students observe thermometer readings in different situations

divisions.name: What Is Temperature?
conceptual_understanding: Temperature indicates how hot or cold an object is

divisions.name: Measuring Temperature
conceptual_understanding: Thermometers are used to measure temperature accurately

divisions.name: Effect of Temperature
conceptual_understanding: Temperature affects materials and living beings
student_can_achieve: Relate temperature changes to daily-life situations

chapters.name: A Journey through States of Water
agenda: Learn processes of change of state

session_instructions.text: Explain states of water using real-life observations
Demonstrate melting and evaporation experiments

image_assets.name: States of Water and Water Cycle

divisions.name: States of Water
conceptual_understanding: Water exists as solid, liquid, and gas

divisions.name: Change of State
conceptual_understanding: Heating and cooling cause changes in states of water
student_can_achieve: Explain melting, freezing, evaporation, and condensation

divisions.name: Water Cycle
conceptual_understanding: Water circulates continuously through the water cycle
student_can_achieve: Describe the stages of the water cycle

chapters.name: Methods of Separation in Everyday Life
agenda: Understand why separation of substances is needed
Relate separation methods to daily life

session_instructions.text: Explain separation using real-life examples like cleaning grains
Students perform simple filtration and evaporation demonstrations

divisions.name: Why Do We Separate Substances?
conceptual_understanding: Separation helps remove unwanted components
Pure substances are needed for specific uses

divisions.name: Handpicking, Winnowing and Sieving
conceptual_understanding: Different methods suit different mixtures

divisions.name: Filtration and Evaporation
conceptual_understanding: Insoluble solids can be removed by filtration
Evaporation separates dissolved solids

divisions.name: Everyday Applications
conceptual_understanding: Separation methods are used in households and industries
student_can_achieve: Relate separation methods to real-life scenarios

session_instructions.text: Discuss life processes with examples of plants and animals
Students observe living organisms and list their characteristics

divisions.name: Characteristics of Living Organisms
conceptual_understanding: Living things grow, reproduce, and respond to stimuli

divisions.name: Plants and Animals
conceptual_understanding: Plants and animals show different life processes

divisions.name: Adaptations
conceptual_understanding: Living organisms adapt to their surroundings

session_instructions.text: Introduce natural resources using examples from surroundings
Students list renewable and non-renewable resources

image_assets.name: Natural Resources
image_assets.relevant: Understanding types and importance of resources

divisions.name: Types of Natural Resources
conceptual_understanding: Natural resources are materials provided by nature
Resources can be renewable or non-renewable

divisions.name: Uses of Natural Resources
conceptual_understanding: Human life depends heavily on natural resources
student_can_achieve: Explain the importance of natural resources

divisions.name: Conservation of Resources
conceptual_understanding: Conservation ensures availability of resources for the future

chapters.name: Beyond Earth
agenda: Understand basic structure of the universe

session_instructions.text: Explain Earthâ€™s position in the universe using models
Students create a simple solar system diagram

divisions.name: Earth, Moon and Sun
conceptual_understanding: Earth, Moon, and Sun have unique movements and roles
student_can_achieve: Explain day, night, and phases of the Moon

divisions.name: Other Celestial Bodies
conceptual_understanding: Stars, planets, and galaxies make up the universe

divisions.name: Space Exploration
conceptual_understanding: Humans explore space using satellites and spacecraft
student_can_achieve: Explain the purpose of space missions
